page.title: 06HOLCOMBE FARM
page.content: Holcombe farmhouse is 275 years old, but the farm itself is much older. On the wall, Roman numerals date it as 1710. The owners have lived there for 18 years,making some changes; the farm is now keeping beef cattle, but in April 1985 they sold 90 milking cows. Holcombe Farm has 97 acres, and Hill Farm has 130 acres. The machinery used on the farm consists of tractors, trailers, mower, bailer,they also have a contractor,used for silage and combining.There is one paid employee on the farm. The one big problem is making the cattle and crops grow quickly, because the fertiliser and medicals are expensive. One milking cow raised from a calf costs Â£150,with feed, which is hay and cattlecake. When the crops are ready they are sold:if they are good quality they go to different places:
